intro: Chamissoa angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf chamissoa, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open, sunny habitats. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chamissoa angustifolia is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
